alert.note: Alert for Inland Northern Brevard (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 03 at 6:08PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Okeechobee, Martin, Saint Lucie, Indian River, Brevard, and Osceola. * WHEN...Through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Potential Tropical Cyclone One is expected to bring heavy rainfall and the potential for flooding across parts of east- central Florida. Rainfall totals of 4 to 8 inches are forecast across Okeechobee, Martin, Saint Lucie, and Indian River Counties, with locally higher amounts up to 10 inches possible. There will be a sharp rainfall gradient across Osceola and Brevard Counties. The southern portions of these counties, from approximately Kenansville to Melbourne south, are forecast to receive 2 to 4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 6 inches possible. The northern portions of Osceola and Brevard Counties are forecast to receive 1 to 2 inches of rain, with locally higher amounts up to 3 inches possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
